p: As a part of cell-based screening of 725 FDA-approved drugs, Lovastatin, an HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor was tested against ZIKV and found to be potent through a dose–response assay (EC50 = 20.7 _ 8.6 mM) [ 96]. Another related drug, Mevastatin also showed anti-ZIKV activity at concentrations of 1–5 mM, but found not to be dose-responsive above 5 mM [ 112]. Since Mevastatin is known to induce apoptosis [ 134], perhaps it showed lack of antiviral activity at higher concentrations.
